titleStmt.title: Description of University of Manchester Library, Gaster Hebrew MS 146: Karaite prayer book for Passover and Shavuot

notesStmt.note: Occasional marginal corrections and additions of one or several words on e.g. folios 1b, 10b, 11a, 29b, 40a, 43b, 45b, 64a, 65b, 70b, 72b, 75a, 78b, 111a-b, 116b, 121b; three line addition written parallel to the edge of the paper on folio 61a, in the hand of the scribe; two lines addition written parallel to outer text margin continuing main text on folio 83b
Prayer book for Shavuot: headings in larger characters. Tiberian vocalisation, at times in red ink (see decoration). This part was written by at least two hands.

msContents.summary: Seventeenth-century Karaite prayer book for Passover and Shavuot in Hebrew with Judeo-Arabic liturgical instructions, all or in part produced in Jerusalem. Incomplete. The Passover and Shavuot parts have been written by a number of hands. With Tiberian vocalisation. Prayer book for Passover: beginning and end missing. Headings of different sizes and blank space for indication of subdivision, when no heading is present. Tiberian vocalisation. Hand briefly changes on folios 91a-92a. Passover is being referred to as the Festival of Unleavened Bread (חג המצות). With Judeo-Arabic liturgical instructions.

msItem.title: Karaite prayer book for Passover and Shavuot
msItem.colophon: [Folio 106a] [?כתב]תי אני בידי לעצמי אני אברהם כהן בן ?נהר / [...] כהן נבע בן כמר [...] ידידיה הכהן / [...] בירושלם ככבוד תחת כסא הכבוד נבע / [...] התכ"ח ליצירה ושלום על ישראל אמן

msItem.title: Gaster Hebrew MS 146/1: Prayer book for Passover, or Seder Tefillot le-Fesaḥ [ff.1a-96b].
Gaster Hebrew MS 146/2: Prayer book for Shavuot, or Seder Tefillot le-Shavu'ot [ff.97a-137b].

support.watermark: Circle: folios 9, 26, 29, 68, 81, 90; circle with arrow: folios 39, 43, 58; oblique rectangle: folio 45; five-angled star and circle: folios 55, 60, 80; star: folio 75; spade with curved line in circle: folios 58, 66, 67, 83; crescent: folio 98; six-angled star with crescent: folio 99; tail: folio104; flower: folios 109, 110; pedestal with letters VER: folio 111; flourish: folios 112, 116, 117, 119, 123, 124, 126, 127, 128; cross in box: folio 120

supportDesc.foliation: Modern pencil foliation in Arabic numerals at the top outer corner of side a of each folio, legible up to folio 135; no foliation on blank folios between 13 and 14, 63 and 64, 96 and 97; two unnumbered folios at the beginning of the codex and three unnumbered ones after folio 137

layoutDesc.layout: Long line with between 19 and 21 written lines
Prayer book for Shavuot: long line with between 19 and 23 written lines

decoDesc.decoNote: Initial-words on all pages are made in black ink: Folio 30a: delineated initial-words with a gold coloured line, initial-words surrounded by black ink dots; black initial-words delineated with red ink: folios 106a-108a, 109b, 110b-112a, 113a, 115b-117a, 118b-119a, 120a, 121a-b, 122b, 123b, 125a, 128b; folios 111b and 123b: Black ink initial-words delineated with red ink and decorated with red ink fleur de lys motifs; marginal words / text words / vocalisation in red: folios 10b, 12b, 15b, 19a, 102a, 104a, 106a, 107b-108b, 109b-115a, 116a, 117a, 118b-119a, 120a-123b, 125a-128b, 133a-b, 135b-136a, 137a-b
30aDelineated initial-words with a gold coloured line, initial-words surrounded by black ink dots.
111bBlack ink initial-words delineated with red ink and decorated with red ink fleur de lys motifs.
121aSmall drawing of a panel with the word הנוא in the margin. Black initial-words delineated with red ink
123bBlack ink initial-words delineated with red ink and decorated with red ink fleur de lys motifs.
125aWord surrounded by a black ink square panel. Black initial-words delineated with red ink.
128aWord surrounded by a red ink square panel.
129bWords surrounded by a square black ink initial panel that has been filled with black ink dots.

binding.p: Black leather binding with modern fly-leaves

origin.p: All or in part produced in Jerusalem in 5428 AM (= 1667/1668 CE); 17th century

history.provenance: Acquired by The John Rylands Library from the heirs of Moses Gaster in 1954
